task.title: Place hierarchies
task.shortdesc: Place entities represented as a hierarchy.

context.p: Apply these instructions for field 752 (hierarchical place name) and for geographic subdivisions (6XXz) when there is a sequence of two or more.
752 entries and sequences of two or more geographic subdivisions represent a chain of places defined by part_of relationships.

The actual entity represented is the last (i.e., most specific) subdivision in the heading or sequence. Preceding subdivisions should be linked in reverse order from the last geographic element in the hierarchy.

section.title: Source data
section.codeblock: --- name: HierarchicalPlaces sampleBibs: - 35599 - 3802854 # Source data fields fieldSpec: - 6XXz - 752014abcdefgh trimPunctuation: true scriptInclusion: BOTH

step.cmd: Generate and store a top-level place resource for the last subdivision, identified by an IRI.

substep.cmd: Ignore subfields 014e when creating a key for matching and merging.
As the value of the matching key, use the current and preceding subdivision values.
Join subdivision values with space-separated double hyphens ( -- ).

stepxmp.codeblock: 752 $a United States $b New York (State) $d New York $f Brooklyn.

ul.li: Matching key for last (most specific) subdivision: united states -- new york state -- new york -- brooklyn
Matching key for preceding (third) subdivision: united states -- new york state -- new york
Matching key for preceding (second) subdivision: united states -- new york state
Matching key for preceding (first) subdivision: united states

substep.cmd: If a field includes a $0 with an IRI, output an equivalent reference.

info.note: The Type of the equivalent reference should match the Type of the top-level resource.

step.cmd: Working back from the last subdivision, generate and store a top-level place resource for each preceding geographic subdivision, identified by IRIs.
Link the place entities using the part_of property.
As the _label and Primary Name of each place entity, use the value of the respective subdivision.
Construct the chain of place entities for 752 entries.

stepxmp.codeblock: 752 $a United States $b New York (State) $d New York $f Brooklyn.

step.cmd: In each referring record-level resource (LinguisticObject, Set, VisualItem), add an embedded reference to the most specific 752 entity.
Construct the chain of place entities for sequences of two or more 6XXz subdivisions.

stepxmp.codeblock: 650 0 $a Folk songs, Romanian $z Romania $z Loviștea Region $v Texts.
